info.name: NutJS Desktop Automation API
info.description: Complete REST API for desktop automation using NutJS. Supports mouse control, keyboard input, clipboard operations, screen capture/recognition, and real-time event recording.

exec: pm.test('Response time is less than 5000ms', function () {

request.description:
Move the mouse cursor to specified coordinates.

**Parameters:**
- `x` (required): X coordinate (minimum: 0)
- `y` (required): Y coordinate (minimum: 0)
- `smooth` (optional): Enable smooth movement (default: true)
- `duration` (optional): Movement duration in ms (100-5000, default: 1000)

Click at specified coordinates.

**Parameters:**
- `x` (required): X coordinate
- `y` (required): Y coordinate
- `button` (optional): Mouse button - "left", "right", "middle" (default: "left")
- `doubleClick` (optional): Perform double click (default: false)
- `smooth` (optional): Move smoothly before clicking (default: true)
- `duration` (optional): Movement duration in ms (100-5000, default: 1000)

Scroll the mouse wheel.

**Parameters:**
- `direction` (required): "up" or "down"
- `amount` (optional): Number of scroll units (1-10, default: 3)
- `smooth` (optional): Enable smooth scrolling (default: true)
- `duration` (optional): Scroll duration in ms (100-5000, default: 1000)
Get the current mouse cursor position.

Stream mouse position in real-time using Server-Sent Events.

**Note:** This endpoint requires API key authentication and returns a continuous stream of position data.
Example of instant mouse movement without smooth animation (duration: 0).
Example of very slow smooth movement taking 5 seconds (maximum duration).
Move mouse to the top-left corner of the screen (0, 0).
Example of right-click action at specific coordinates.
Example of middle mouse button click without smooth movement.
Example of double-click action to open files or select text.
Example of horizontal drag (useful for sliders or horizontal scrolling).
Example of vertical drag (useful for scrolling or moving items vertically).
Example of quick drag with minimum duration (100ms) and no smooth movement.
Example of maximum scroll amount (10 units) with smooth scrolling.
Example of minimal scroll (1 unit) upward without smooth animation.

Type text with configurable timing.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (required): Text to type (max 10000 characters)
- `mode` (optional): Typing mode - "instant", "perChar", "total" (default: "instant")
- `value` (optional): Time value in ms:
  - For "perChar": delay between each character
  - For "total": total duration for typing all text
  - Max: 300000ms (5 minutes)

Press a specific key.

**Supported keys:**
- Navigation: enter, tab, escape, space, backspace, delete
- Arrows: up, down, left, right
- Navigation: home, end, pageup, pagedown
- Function: f1-f12

Execute a key combination (e.g., Ctrl+C, Cmd+V).

**Parameters:**
- `keys` (required): Array of keys to press together (max 5 keys)

**Supported modifier keys:**
- ctrl/control, alt, shift, cmd/command/meta/win

**Supported letter keys:**
- a, c, v, x, z, y
Example of typing a long paragraph of text instantly without delay.
Example of typing text with various special characters.
Example of typing text with emoji characters.
Example of very fast typing with minimal delay between characters.
Example of very slow typing with 500ms delay between each character.
Select all text in the current field or document (Ctrl+A).
Paste content from clipboard (Ctrl+V).
Undo the last action (Ctrl+Z).

exec: // This example demonstrates pressing Tab key 5 times
// You would need to make 5 separate API calls to achieve this

request.description: Press Tab key to navigate between form fields. Note: To press Tab multiple times, you need to make multiple API calls. This example shows a single Tab press.
Press F5 key to refresh the current page or application.

Copy content to system clipboard.

**Parameters:**
- `content` (required): Text to copy (max 1 MB)
Get current clipboard content.

response.name: Success with Content

request.description: Clear clipboard content.
Example of copying a long text with multiple paragraphs to clipboard.
Example of copying JSON data to clipboard (useful for testing data transfer).
Example of copying code snippet to clipboard with proper formatting.
Example of copying a URL to clipboard.

body.raw:
{
  "content": "Subject: Desktop Automation Test Report

Dear Team,

I am pleased to share the results of our latest desktop automation tests:

• Test Suite: Login Flow
• Total Tests: 25
• Passed: 23
• Failed: 2
• Duration: 3m 45s

Please review the attached detailed report.

Best regards,
QA Team"
}

request.description: Example of copying an email template with formatting.
Example of copying special unicode characters and symbols.
Example of copying base64 encoded data (1x1 transparent PNG).

Capture a screenshot of the entire screen or a specific region.

**Parameters:**
- `region` (optional): Object with x, y, width, height for specific area
- `format` (optional): "png" or "jpg" (default: "png")

Find an image template on the screen.

**Parameters:**
- `template` (required): Base64 encoded image to search for
- `confidence` (optional): Match confidence threshold 0-1 (default: 0.8)
- `region` (optional): Limit search to specific region {x, y, width, height}

Wait for an image to appear on screen.

**Parameters:**
- `template` (required): Base64 encoded image to wait for
- `timeout` (optional): Max wait time in ms (default: 5000)
- `confidence` (optional): Match confidence threshold 0-1 (default: 0.8)
- `region` (optional): Limit search to specific region
Capture a specific region of the screen (e.g., a window or dialog box).
Capture full screen in JPEG format (smaller file size, lossy compression).
Find image with high confidence (0.95) for precise matching.
Find image with low confidence (0.5) for fuzzy matching.

item.name: Find on Screen - Search in Region

request.description: Search for image only in the top-left quadrant of the screen.
Wait up to 30 seconds for an image to appear (useful for slow-loading applications).
Quick 1-second check for an image in a specific region.
Example of validation error response

response.name: Validation Error

request.description: Example of text exceeding maximum length

response.name: Success - GPT-3.5 Turbo
Success - With System Prompt

body.raw:
{
  "prompt": "What is NutJS?",
  "model": "gpt-4.1",
  "temperature": 0.5,
  "maxTokens": 200,
  "systemPrompt": "You are a helpful assistant specializing in desktop automation tools and libraries. Provide concise, technical answers."
}

item.name: Generate Completion with Custom Output Format

exec: pm.test('Output format is correctly applied', function () {

response.name: Success - Structured Response
Error - Invalid Output Format

body.raw:
{
  "prompt": "Write a JavaScript function to control mouse movement with NutJS.",
  "model": "gpt-4.1",
  "temperature": 0.3,
  "maxTokens": 300,
  "systemPrompt": "You are a coding assistant specialized in desktop automation. Provide clean, working code examples."
}

request.description: Example using GPT-4.1 model with low temperature for precise code generation.
Example using GPT-4.1-mini model for cost-effective completions.

body.raw:
{
  "prompt": "Explain the architecture of a desktop automation API in simple terms.",
  "model": "deepseek-chat",
  "temperature": 0.6,
  "maxTokens": 250,
  "systemPrompt": "You are a technical educator. Explain complex concepts in simple, understandable terms."
}

request.description: Example using DeepSeek V3 (deepseek-chat) - Fast model with tool calling support.

body.raw:
{
  "prompt": "Solve this step by step: What is the optimal strategy for implementing desktop automation in a large enterprise with 1000+ users and varying technical skills?",
  "model": "deepseek-reasoner",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "maxTokens": 500,
  "systemPrompt": "You are a strategic consultant. Think through this problem step by step, showing your reasoning process."
}

request.description: Example using DeepSeek R1 (deepseek-reasoner) - Advanced reasoning model that shows thinking process.

body.raw:
{
  "prompt": "Write a TypeScript function that uses NutJS to create a screenshot-based element finder with retry logic and error handling.",
  "model": "deepseek-coder",
  "temperature": 0.3,
  "maxTokens": 400,
  "systemPrompt": "You are an expert TypeScript developer. Write clean, well-documented code with proper error handling and types."
}

request.description: Example using DeepSeek Coder (deepseek-coder) - Specialized for coding tasks, alias for deepseek-chat.

body.raw:
{
  "prompt": "Create 5 innovative ideas for using desktop automation in unexpected ways.",
  "model": "gpt-4.1",
  "temperature": 1.5,
  "maxTokens": 400,
  "systemPrompt": "You are a creative innovator. Think outside the box and suggest unconventional applications."
}

request.description: Example with high temperature (1.5) for more creative and diverse outputs.

body.raw:
{
  "prompt": "Convert this pseudocode to Python: 'move mouse to (100, 200), wait 2 seconds, click left button'",
  "model": "gpt-4.1-mini",
  "temperature": 0,
  "maxTokens": 150,
  "systemPrompt": "You are a code converter. Convert pseudocode to valid Python code using pyautogui library. Be precise and deterministic."
}

request.description: Example with temperature 0 for deterministic, consistent outputs.
Example with array output format for list responses.
Example with boolean output format for yes/no decisions.
Example with number output format for ratings or scores.
Example with complex nested object structure for detailed test plans.
Minimal request with only required fields (prompt and model). Uses default values for temperature (0.7) and maxTokens (1000).

body.raw:
{
  "prompt": "Write a comprehensive guide on desktop automation best practices, covering tools, frameworks, patterns, and real-world examples.",
  "model": "gpt-4.1",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "maxTokens": 4096,
  "systemPrompt": "You are a technical writer creating detailed documentation."
}

request.description: Example using maximum allowed tokens (4096) for long-form content generation.
